title: I heard that musicians and video editors buy Macs. Is that true? Is it still true now? Has it ever been true? Or will Windows serve you fine? - Quora

response.answer_text: A lot of music programs that are considered industry standard (Logic, Pro-tools, Reason) are designed mainly for MacBooks, and they do run fairly smoothly. I go to Berklee where students are forced to buy MacBooks, which most people use as a glorified FaceBook machine.  MacBooks, work decently for the first year of your ownership, then all sorts of problems arise (absurd battery heat, bad performance, lots of crashing) and parts fall apart. They are extremely fragile computers. Macbooks are good looking and overpriced because they are MacBooks. You could alternatively buy a laptop with the same specs and parts (or even better) for half the price of a MacBook, but you won't look as cool when you're at Starbucks.
I am a musician with a MacBook Pro that I use to record and mix music; and also to edit video (at home.) For those and many other reasons I have always been a Mac user. It is well worth the price.
